Dating: NEOLITHIC PERIOD (not before); NEOLITHIC PERIOD ?; PREDYNASTIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Concave-based arrowhead
Description: This arrowhead has a pronounced concave base and has been carefully retouched on both sides. The retouching covers the entire object. Such arrowheads are particularly characteristic of the Faiyum Neolithic Period (5th millennium BC), but are also common in the Early Predynastic Period, particularly the Badarian Period.
